predictions.text: U.S. PCE price index excluding food and energy (core) year-over-year for September 2025 will be between 2.6% and 2.9%, as reported by BEA on 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm the 12-month percent change in core PCE in BEA's Personal Income and Outlays release dated 2025-10-31 falls within [2.6%, 2.9%].
evidence: Fed cut short-term rates but long-term yields rose, tightening conditions; disinflation is gradual.
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/09/20/the-fed-cut-its-interest-rate-but-mortgage-costs-went-higher.html
Historical stickiness in services/core PCE vs CPI.
monitoring_signals: CPI and PPI details (services ex-energy, OER, medical)
BEA deflators in advance GDP update
predictions.rationale: Core disinflation continues but services prices remain sticky. September CPI components imply a core PCE YoY near the high-2s.

predictions.text: U.S. CPI shelter index (BLS series CUSR0000SAH1) month-over-month for September 2025 will be between 0.35% and 0.45% in the CPI release on 2025-10-10.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check BLS CPI detailed tables for series CUSR0000SAH1 (Shelter, SA) MoM percent change; must be ≥0.35% and ≤0.45%.
evidence: Shelter disinflation is slow; private rent measures show moderation, not collapse.
CPI shelter tends to lag market rents by 6–12 months.
monitoring_signals: Apartment List and Zillow rent indices
OER and Rent of Primary Residence sub-indexes
Local CPI shelter trends in large metro areas
predictions.rationale: Lagged lease renewals sustain elevated, but easing, shelter inflation, keeping MoM near 0.4%.

predictions.text: The U.S. 10Y–3M Treasury yield spread (FRED: T10Y3M) will be at or above -0.90 percentage points on at least one trading day by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Using FRED series T10Y3M daily values, confirm any close on or before 2025-10-31 is ≥ -0.90%.
evidence: Fed cut front-end rates; long-end yields rose, reducing inversion.
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/09/20/the-fed-cut-its-interest-rate-but-mortgage-costs-went-higher.html
monitoring_signals: Futures-implied path of the Fed funds rate
predictions.rationale: Front-end easing alongside sticky long rates should drive incremental curve steepening toward less negative levels.

predictions.text: Euro area unemployment rate for August 2025 will print between 6.2% and 6.6% in Eurostat’s release on 2025-09-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify the EA (EA19/EA20) headline unemployment rate in Eurostat’s 2025-09-30 news release falls within [6.2%, 6.6%].
evidence: Euro area unemployment has been stable near mid-6%.
No major labor shock reported in recent weeks.
monitoring_signals: Country labor prints (DE, FR, IT, ES)
predictions.rationale: Labor markets remain resilient but softening gradually; headline rate should remain anchored around 6.4%.

predictions.text: UK CPI (headline) year-over-year for September 2025 will be between 2.3% and 3.1% in the ONS release due 2025-10-16.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check ONS CPI annual headline rate in the 2025-10-16 release; it must be ≥2.3% and ≤3.1%.
evidence: Energy base effects largely passed; services inflation elevated but easing.
GBP and fuel dynamics modestly tighten conditions.
monitoring_signals: Energy price caps and utility components
predictions.rationale: UK inflation should remain close to target but above 2%, with services inflation offsetting goods disinflation.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31, OFAC will announce at least one sanctions designation under its China- or Hong Kong-related programs via public press release or sanctions list update.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm an OFAC press release or sanctions list update adding at least one person/entity under PRC- or Hong Kong-related authorities by 2025-10-31 on home.treasury.gov/sanctions.
evidence: Ongoing U.S.-China policy actions and oversight intensification.
BIS/OFAC cadence of China-related measures.
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/09/20/trump-h-1b-visa-tech-foreign-governments.html
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/09/20/trump-golden-share-us-steel.html
monitoring_signals: OFAC Press Releases and Recent Actions pages
predictions.rationale: Heightened U.S.-China tensions and ongoing enforcement cycles make at least one designation likely in the window.

predictions.text: ICE Endex Dutch TTF front-month natural gas futures will settle at or above €40.00 per MWh on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify ICE Endex front-month TTF settlement ≥ €40.00/MWh on any trading day through 2025-11-30 (official exchange settlement).
evidence: Seasonal demand, maintenance, and geopolitical risks can spike European gas.
Volatility persists despite improved storage norms.
predictions.rationale: Shoulder-season volatility and supply risks create upside tail scenarios for TTF prices.

predictions.text: LME 3-month Copper official settlement price will reach at or above $9,800 per metric ton on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm LME official 3M Copper price ≥ $9,800/mt on any day through 2025-11-30 via LME price reports.
evidence: Chinese credit impulses (TSF) influence copper demand.
Tight mine supply and low visible inventories can lift prices.
Related macro tailwinds from infrastructure/EV demand.
monitoring_signals: China TSF, PMI new orders, property measures
predictions.rationale: Modest Chinese policy support and constrained supply argue for at least one upside price excursion.

predictions.text: For the week ending 2025-10-04, the EIA Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report will show a U.S. working gas change between +70 and +100 Bcf, in the report released by 2025-10-10.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check EIA Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report published by 2025-10-10; the reported net change for week ending 2025-10-04 must be within [+70, +100] Bcf.
evidence: Seasonal injection window with typical early-October builds.
Production remains high; weather still moderate.
predictions.rationale: Seasonality and production suggest a near-average injection in early October.

predictions.text: USD/MXN (Yahoo Finance: MXN=X) will close at or above 18.50 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Using Yahoo Finance MXN=X (USD/MXN) daily close (UTC), confirm any close ≥ 18.50 by 2025-11-30.
evidence: Higher U.S. long rates tighten global financial conditions.
EM FX sensitive to risk-off and China growth concerns.
Oil and trade flows affect MXN.
predictions.rationale: Tighter global conditions and U.S. yield dynamics raise odds of episodic MXN weakness.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31, the Federal Register will publish at least one DHS/USCIS proposed, interim final, or final rule—or fee notice—addressing H-1B petition fees.
predictions.verification_criteria: Search federalregister.gov for DHS/USCIS publications through 2025-10-31 that explicitly modify or establish H-1B petition fees.
evidence: Reports of a $100,000 H-1B fee signal imminent regulatory action.
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/09/20/trump-h-1b-visa-tech-foreign-governments.html
https://techcrunch.com/2025/09/20/amazon-google-microsoft-warn-h-1b-employees-to-stay-in-the-us/
predictions.rationale: Public signaling around large fee changes typically precedes formal rulemaking or fee notices.

predictions.text: By 2025-10-31, the U.S. Commerce Department’s BIS will add at least five entities with PRC addresses to the Entity List, as published in the Federal Register.
predictions.verification_criteria: Count additions of entities with PRC addresses to the Entity List in Federal Register notices through 2025-10-31; total must be ≥5.
evidence: Ongoing tightening of AI/semiconductor-related controls on China.
Expectation of additional BIS actions this fall.
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/09/20/openai-leads-private-market-surge-as-7-startups-reach-1point3-trillion.html
monitoring_signals: BIS press releases and FR notices
predictions.rationale: Entity List additions are a frequent tool; further PRC-focused designations are likely alongside broader control updates.
